about.title: About Me
about.meta_description: Learn about Dmitriy Kairgeldin — Frontend Engineer with 3+ years of experience in React, Next.js, TypeScript, and performance optimization.
about.bio: Frontend Engineer with 3+ years of experience building high-performance web applications. I specialize in React, Next.js, and TypeScript, with a deep focus on performance optimization, caching strategies, and delivering exceptional user experiences.
about.bio_extended: Currently working at Daribar, where I led initiatives that reduced server load from 60-80% to 2-5% and improved Lighthouse scores to 90+. I'm passionate about writing clean, scalable code and solving complex frontend architecture challenges.

highlights: Led performance optimization that reduced server load from 60-80% to 2-5%, significantly lowering infrastructure costs
Designed and implemented caching strategy using Next.js SSR, CDN-level caching, and device/locale-based cache segmentation
Improved Core Web Vitals (LCP, TTFB) and Lighthouse scores to 90+, directly impacting SEO and conversions
Owned complex business-critical flows: multi-step checkout, async cascading filters, dynamic i18n routing, SEO-safe SSR
Refactored UI architecture to reduce re-renders, simplify state management, and improve scalability
Built and maintained production-ready front-end architecture from scratch, including admin dashboards and reusable component systems
Solved complex cross-platform issues (mobile, WebView), ensuring consistent UX across devices
Collaborated closely with designers and backend engineers using React, Next.js, TypeScript, and Redux Toolkit
Contributed to the creation, development, and market launch of an innovative job search service with unique features like NeuroResume
Improved team collaboration and backend integration using ClickUp, React, Bootstrap 5, Redux, and Git
